intro: Aldama atacamensis, commonly known as the Atacama Aldama, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of northern Chile. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its distinctive, showy bracts that resemble flowers. The plant has adapted to survive in extreme desert conditions with its succulent stems and reduced leaves. It produces small, pale yellow flowers that bloom during the rainy season. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
